headline: Meaty Stuffed Pepper Casserole
description: Green bell peppers, plenty of ground beef and pork sausage, and Cheddar cheese give this hearty casserole the flavor of stuffed peppers without all the work.
name: Meaty Stuffed Pepper Casserole
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pinch dried oregano, or to taste
1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir green bell peppers, onion, and garlic in the hot butter until vegetables are slightly soft, 2 minutes. Stir sausage and ground beef into bell pepper mixture; cook until meat is crumbly and browned, stirring often, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain grease. Season mixture with salt, black pepper, oregano, and garlic powder.

Mix diced tomatoes, rice, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce into meat mixture and bring to a simmer; cook until heated through, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour mixture into a large baking dish.
Whisk tomato soup with water in a bowl until smooth; pour soup over meat mixture. Spread Cheddar cheese over casserole.
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is heated through and Cheddar cheese is browned and bubbling, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved it! I did add some extra taco seasoning and mixed it with Spanish rice. It was amazing!

This recipe was disappointing. At best it is mediocre. The tomato soup overwhelmed the flavors of the other ingredients. The dish really turned out very soupy and not like a casserole. If I was too make it again, I would reduce the tomato soup by half and double the amount of rice.

These were my substitutions. -6 large peppers -1 tablespoon oregano -3 cups cook rice(important) -14 oz tomato paste -1 and 1/2 worchestershire -substitute a jar of spaghetti sauce Remove the tomato soup and water(yuck) -I used hot Italian sausage but that's me -I used shredded cheddar to lightly cover the sauce then topped with slices of provalone. 4.8 out of 5 stars
I divided this recipe in half and left out the sausage but it was absolutely amazing!!!!! The kids loved it so much.
pretty easy, used 1 large can crushed tomatoes instead of the soup, looks good so far

This was good but mine turned out more like soup. Not sure what I did wrong. Used cooked barley instead of rice because I lake it better. Replaced the hamburger with turkey and added a few jalapeños for a spicier flavor. Did not set up in the pan. Next time I’ll just leave in the large pot I cooked it in and eat as a thick soup instead of dirtying another pan.
I didn't want to stuff the peppers so I made this casserole - it is the BEST!!! Tons of meat and flavors are divine. This recipe is a keeper - thanks!
We used ground turkey for burger. We only used 1 can of tomato soup. It was a little dryer. Now it was really good only 2 of us so we reheated it adding more cheese and it was great again!

This was a really good casserole. I changed it slightly based on what I had on hand and how I make my stuffed peppers. I used 1 1/2 lb of ground beef and I added 3 stalks of finely diced celery, 2 diced carrots, and only added one can of diced tomatoes. Instead of the soup and tomato paste, I used about ½ of a 24oz jar of jarred Spaghetti sauce. It came out perfect!
It was good. I think next time I will use progresso tomato and basil soup, you dont need to add water and I think it will give extra flavor.
Out of preference, I used red and orange peppers. I only used one can of tomato soup, and next time I'll double the rice. Easy to adjust to your liking. Husband loved it!
love the recipe but I added an extra cup of rice and added cheese inside the casserole mixture.

I made this dish foe my 5 boys. They really liked it! I will definitely make this dish again. I made this recipe almost to the recipe. Here is what was different. I didn’t have green peppers so I used 2 large red and yellow peppers. I would add more rice because 1 cup just is t enough. Other that that, it was great.

Delicious recipe! Dumping all Ingredients in a bowl is easier to fix and eat than stuffing pepper. I substituted sausage with sirloin burger and Italian seasoning. Also replaced the soup, paste and water with 2 - 15oz cans diced tomatoes, and 1 15oz can tomato sauce. Topped with Asiago cheese instead of cheddar.
Easy to make, very good. All of my family told me to put a star beside this recipe!
This was so good! We are a family of 8 and 7/8 of us loved it. It makes enough for leftovers too. It is easier than a regular stuffed pepper. We did add more rice but other than that, it’s perfect!
I made it exactly as listed and it was a hit. This is more than enough for eight people. This will be part of our regular rotation now. Thanks for the great recipe.

This quite possibly is my favorite dish I have found on AllRecipes. The only tweak, which I think might be a typo in the directions, is that I use 3 cups of cooked rice, which is, in fact, 1 cup of dry rice. This is now a frequent dish in the rotation.
Loved it. I subbed firm tofu for the meat and added 2 eggs. Otherwise followed the recipe. Really great.
Great recipe and a crowd pleaser! Much easier than stuffed peppers to make. I used V8 on the top instead of tomato soup. Otherwise made the recipe as shown.

I was looking for a good "unstuffed" bell pepper recipe and this is it! I followed the recipe as written except I took the advice of other reviewers and used 2 cups cooked rice and I'm glade I did. This made A LOT so I had to use my deep lasagna casserole dish to fit it all in. I'll definitely be making this again.

Made this tonight for dinner along with a salad and garlic bread. I cut the recipe in half for my husband & myself, and still put in a 9 x 13 casserole dish. We had plenty leftover ( 1/2 the 9 x 13 ) I will definitely make again. I followed the recipe but used red, yellow and green pepper as that's what I had here. VERY GOOD!!
Made too much for two or maybe four. Would cut in half next time. I add some celery and a little cabbage
I made the recipe as stated. Came out good. I will definitely make again

I used a jar of spaghetti sauce in the mixture and topped it with a can of v8 for convenience. I also used 2 cups of rice. With those changes, this was the best stuffed pepper casserole that I've ever made!
The only thing I did was to add more green pepper. I actually forgot to add the cheese and it was delicious without it too! I did add cheese on top to the leftovers. Very good as a leftover too!!
My husband loves this recipe. the flavor is great.
Excellent!! Sprinkled with bread crumbs before baking. Very good comfort food!
Mouthwaterly delicious!
I make this all of the time. Great for leftover lunches!

It was awesome - VERY filling! I added a large dash of paprika (my husbands adds a dash to every recipe) and I didn't have condensed tomato soup but I did have Trader Joes Tomato Organic Roasted Red Pepper Soup and gave it a good pour over the top. I also didn't have green peppers - used my red, yellow and orange. I think the green would have been good but ALL green would be really bitter. I liked the mix. Made so much I froze 1/2. and have another meal for a family of four to go. Thanks for sharing!
I really liked the taste but it came out soupy. Won’t add the water next time.

I made no changes. I should have cooked it a little longer. Was kind of soupy. Buttt overall it’s very good. Took me a lot more time to cook though without any food processor. Also I didn’t have a Dutch oven but did have a big deep skillet. When I placed in baking dish I bet it weighed over 5 pounds. It was delicious
Very good, used colby jack, habenaro infused diced tomatoes and an extra cup of rice. Will definitely make again.
My husband loved it. He said it’s versatile. You can put leftovers on spaghetti. Use it on pizza dough. Add beans and a little heat, and it turns into chili.
My husband and I thought this was really good. This will become one of our regular meals.

Pretty decent. I will make it again with the following modifications: more diced peppers, less or no canned soup (felt like it added a lot of salt), and more diced tomatoes.

I cooked it off for a week's worth of lunches at work. Everyone commented how good it smelled. It is a great basic spin on stuffed peppers that can be adjusted easily for personal taste.

i tried cooking with my own style... mixing some diced potato and carrots... added some sour cream, spices and grated cheese... my husband and our friend told me are so tasty...
will do it again soon... thanks for the recipe shared.
Everyone loved this. I did some substitutions and it was still a big hit
So yummy!! I added shredded cauliflower in place of rice for a 'paleo' version. There was plenty to share with friends and family.

Anything that starts with sauteed peppers, onions and garlic draws attention at my house. This was a good tasting variation of a stuffed green pepper. Everyone who tried it agreed. My daughter grabbed a bag of corn chips and used it as a dip. I ate it right off the plate. I doubled the recipe and thought it needed a little more spice so I will tweek it and try it again.
I changed this recipe to....... steamed peppers, mixed meat ,used spaghetti sauce and parm and mozzarella cheese and rice and layered like lasagna. Thanks for the ideal.
This was very good made no changes. I made additional rice on side and poured over the rice. My husband is requesting again. It is a favorite!!!!!!
I made this and did not make any changes. We really liked the flavor, but it was even better the next day!

I made the recipe as stated except I doubled the rice. It made enough to feed my family of 5 including 2 teenage sons with about 1/3 left over. For me it was very (almost too) tomato-y, but my family loved it. My son just walked back to the kitchen for thirds, & my husband said it was so good he could just keep eating it. I may cut the tomatoes by using one can of diced tomatoes & topping with one can of soup next time - just my preference. My husband & kids wouldn't change a thing and definitely want me to make it again! Thank you for sharing.
My new favorite recipe!!!
One of my favorites!!!!
Very good! My husband loved it & so did I. Just one cup of water for the tomato soup is good though. 2 cups as called for on the can is too much.

i made this last night and wow wow wow me and my husband were so pleasanrtly amazed and happy. I will be making this alot more, but i just used 1 pound of hamburger and a little more rice. 2 thumbs up please please try this recipe it is amazing, it is now one of our favorites
OMG Looks way better than the picture and tastes absolutely fantastic!! I did add 1 packet of dried onion soup. Also, there is only 2 of us, so I divided it in 1/2 and froze 1/2.
Pretty good flavor but not really considered easier than stuffed with 16 ingredients. sorry

Absolutely delicious. Made some minor changes- 1 -14oz petite diced tomatoes and 1-14oz can crushed tomatoes instead of all diced. Used 1 lb beef and 1/2 lb sausage, and increased rice. Was wonderful and enjoyed by whole family. Mine needed bit longer baking at about 40 minutes. Will make again for sure!

Based on other reviews, I cut down on most ingredients - used 1.5 pounds of ground turkey, 2 large peppers, 1/2 an onion, 1 can petite diced tomatoes. Used 1.5 cups of uncooked rice, lots of worcestershire and most of a 19 ounce can of Progresso tomato basil soup (omitted the water). This filled up a 9x13 baking dish, fed a family of 4 and still had leftovers. Husband had 4 helpings! That never happens! Thanks for a great, easy, yummy recipe!
Awesome!

My husband and I love this recipe, and I make it often. Because it's just the two of us, I cut the recipe in half except for the rice. However, instead of the rice, I stir in 1 package of cooked riced cauliflower. My husband, who doesn't like cooked cauliflower, has never noticed!

This is one of my favorite recipes! I make it for dinner at home, as well as for family and church pitch-ins! The only part if this recipe that I have changed up is substituting a large jar of my favorite spaghetti sauce for the tomato paste and crushed tomatoes. It saves me time!

Awesome just the way it is! I’m generous with the spices. I’ve also substituted tomato sauce when I didn’t have soup. I’ve also used all hamburger when it was what I had on hand. I’ve also used more rice as necessary. Hubby likes for me to put his in a green pepper, so I stick a couple in the corner of the pan and fill.
used 3 cans tomato sauce--no soup, one can diced tomatoes, chopped red and yellow pepper--no green. Put cheese on last 10 minutes. Didn't get to take any in for my lunch because it was all gone!
This was very good. I was surprised at how well it all came together.
Flavor is good. But there is way too much meat!!! I would definitley cut the meat back to 1/2 lb. of each the sausage and the beef and add an extra 1/2 C. rice

The family loved this! I only changed a few things to meet our liking. I added one fresh jalapeno, chopped, and grated zucchini. I omitted the two cans of tomato soup and can of tomato paste due to the amount of water the zucchini created. It turned out perfect! No "soupiness" to it at all and still left with a satisfying amount of tomato flavor. Thanks for sharing your recipe.

Loved this dish! My son and husband went back for thirds - it was that good! I hate it when people change the recipe and then rate their new version, but I'm going to do it anyway, because I don't think I really changed the integrity of the recipe - but you decide. I wanted a richer tomato flavor for the topping so I used tomato sauce instead. And I used 3 cups of cooked rice. That was it - just a matter of preference. This one's a keeper, however you make it.
The flavor was wonderful. I will add another cup to cup and a half of rice next time though to thicken it up a bit.
This was very good. I followed the recipe as written and thought it had good flavor, but am not a real fan of sausage, so I think I will just double the beef next time.
Used tomato sauce instead of soup! Was great. A keeper in my house!

Delicious! Tastes exactly like a stuffed pepper. My husband doesn't like stuffed peppers - he says there is way too much pepper. He loved it! The only thing I did was added extra rice (our preference), but it would have been just as great with the recommended amount.

I loved this recipe, family loved the recipe! It made a lot, hubby has been using left overs as a dip with corn chips. I will make this again & again & again. I love stuffed peppers just not the whole big pepper part & this solves that problem deliciously! Thank you for sharing rebeccahayden87!

Great kid and picky eater friendly recipe. Easy to make and not easy to mess up. 
I didn't have Italian sausage, so I used breakfast sausage. This was still very yummy. 
Also, I would highly suggest cutting in half or at least down by a third. I served this to 4 girls ages 10 to 16 and myself and still had leftovers, and I cut the recipe down to half. 
One change: I would suggest using more rice.

Very forgiving. I messed up and added a whole can of water to the soup topping. No problem. The boys say this is good and please make again. And in case anyone is wondering, I used frozen green pepper (summer garden abundance) and it was good!
This is my favorite recipe on here, this has a lot of flavor

This was a big hit at my house with both my husband and my 1 year-old. They both cleaned their plates and had seconds. My son actually ate three bowls of this the first time I served it. Winner!
I liked it, too, although it's definitely more of a mild-tasting crowd pleaser than a unique and unusual taste. It's simpler than stuffing peppers, though, and fulfills the same craving.
Although I haven't tried it, I suspect it would freeze well, which is another plus in my book.
Forgot to add photos. It was good.
Great and easy recipe. I cut the recipe in half, only used the hamburger, cooked it in a 9x13 pan and it was still enough for our family of four. All of the flavor of stuffed peppers with less work.
i thought this recipe was very delicious and filling i didnt feel like making the effort to make stuffed peppers today but was craving them so this recipe was awesome thank u for sharing it
